objective.title: Modern Task Management Application
objective.summary: A collaborative web app for small development teams to manage tasks with real-time updates, kanban boards, and mobile-responsive design.

requirements.description: Real-time updates when team members make changes
Due dates, priorities, and labels for tasks
File attachments and comments on tasks

success_criteria.description: Core functionality implemented and tested within 4 weeks
Authentication flows with Google and GitHub verified across browsers
Real‑time updates validated with at least 100 concurrent users
Kanban drag‑and‑drop functional on desktop and mobile devices
Task CRUD operations fully implemented and unit‑tested
Page load time < 2 seconds under typical load
Security: OAuth token handling, HTTPS, password hashing, role‑based access control enforced
Accessibility compliance (WCAG 2.1 AA) for all UI components

refinement_notes.analysis: The listed requirements are generally understandable but are not fully complete; they mix must‑have and nice‑to‑have items without explicit acceptance definitions, and several critical functional, non‑functional, and quality constraints are missing. The single success criterion is measurable but too coarse, lacking verification of each core feature, security checks, performance, and usability. Recommendations focus on clarifying acceptance criteria, adding missing constraints, and expanding measurable success metrics.
refined_success_criteria: Authentication flows with Google and GitHub verified across browsers
Real‑time updates validated with at least 100 concurrent users
Kanban drag‑and‑drop functional on desktop and mobile devices
Task CRUD operations fully implemented and unit‑tested
Page load time < 2 seconds under typical load
Security: OAuth token handling, HTTPS, password hashing, role‑based access control enforced
Accessibility compliance (WCAG 2.1 AA) for all UI components
recommendations: Separate must‑have and nice‑to‑have items and assign clear acceptance tests for each
Add missing non‑functional requirements such as CI/CD pipeline, monitoring, logging, and accessibility
Define a comprehensive testing strategy (unit, integration, end‑to‑end) with coverage thresholds
Specify deployment environment, scaling limits, and performance targets for real‑time features
Document explicit success metrics for security, usability, and maintainability beyond the current single statement
